docs.text: ManaShell : A Magic the Gathering PowerShell tool Search the Scryfall API via PowerShell using this module! Installation Build from source Building from source will require ModuleBuilder from the PowerShell Gallery: Install-Module ModuleBuilder -Scope CurrentUser git clone https:github.com/steviecoaster/ManaShell.git cd ManaShell . ./Build.ps1 -Semver 0.1.0 Import-Module ./ManaShell/0.1.0/ManaShell.psd1 Install through the PowerShell Gallery PowerShell 7+ Install-PSResource ManaShell -Scope CurrentUser Chocolatey (COMING SOON) choco install ManaShell -y -s https://community.chocolatey.org/api/v2
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: Search the Scryfall API via PowerShell using this module!

docs.title: Build from source

docs.text: Install-PSResource ManaShell -Scope CurrentUser
docs.title: PowerShell 7+

docs.text: choco install ManaShell -y -s https://community.chocolatey.org/api/v2
docs.title: Chocolatey (COMING SOON)

docs.text: Get-MtgCard SYNOPSIS Retrieves Magic: The Gathering card data from the Scryfall API. SYNTAX search Get-MtgCard -Name <String> [-Exact] [-Fuzzy] [-Render] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>] random Get-MtgCard [-Random] [-Commander] [-Render] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION The `Get-MtgCard` function retrieves Magic: The Gathering card data using the Scryfall API. It supports searching for cards by name (exact or fuzzy matching) or retrieving a random card. The function can also filter for random cards that are legal as commanders. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Get-MtgCard -Name "Black Lotus" -Exact Searches for the card "Black Lotus" using an exact name match. EXAMPLE 2 Get-MtgCard -Name "Lotus" -Fuzzy Searches for a card with a name similar to "Lotus" using fuzzy matching. EXAMPLE 3 Get-MtgCard -Random Retrieves a random Magic: The Gathering card. EXAMPLE 4 Get-MtgCard -Random -Commander Retrieves a random Magic: The Gathering card that is legal as a commander. EXAMPLE 5 Get-MtgCard -Name "Black Lotus" -Exact -Render Searches for the card "Black Lotus" using an exact name match and renders the card visually. PARAMETERS -Name Specifies the name of the card to search for. This parameter is mandatory when using the `search` parameter set. Type: String Parameter Sets: search Aliases: Required: True Position: Named Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -Exact Performs an exact name search for the specified card. This parameter is part of the `search` parameter set. Type: SwitchParameter Parameter Sets: search Aliases: Required: False Position: Named Default value: False Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -Fuzzy Performs a fuzzy name search for the specified card. This parameter is part of the `search` parameter set. Type: SwitchParameter Parameter Sets: search Aliases: Required: False Position: Named Default value: False Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -Random Retrieves a random Magic: The Gathering card. This parameter is mandatory when using the `random` parameter set. Type: SwitchParameter Parameter Sets: random Aliases: Required: True Position: Named Default value: False Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -Commander Filters random cards to only include those that are legal as commanders. This parameter is part of the `random` parameter set. Type: SwitchParameter Parameter Sets: random Aliases: Required: False Position: Named Default value: False Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -Render If specified, renders the card data visually using the `Show-Card` function. Type: SwitchParameter Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: Required: False Position: Named Default value: False Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -ProgressAction {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} Type: ActionPreference Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: proga Required: False Position: Named Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS Returns the card data retrieved from the Scryfall API as a PowerShell object. If the -Render parameter is specified, the card data is displayed visually instead of being returned. NOTES This function uses the Scryfall API to fetch card data. Ensure you have an active internet connection to use this function. The `Invoke-RestMethod` cmdlet is used to send the API request. RELATED LINKS https://scryfall.com/docs/api
docs.title: Get-MtgCard

docs.text: Get-MtgSet SYNOPSIS Retrieves Magic: The Gathering set data from the Scryfall API. SYNTAX Get-MtgSet [[-Code] <String>] [[-Id] <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION The `Get-MtgSet` function retrieves Magic: The Gathering set data using the Scryfall API. It supports retrieving a specific set by its code or ID, or fetching all available sets. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Get-MtgSet -Code "LEA" Retrieves data for the set "Limited Edition Alpha" using its code. EXAMPLE 2 Get-MtgSet -Id "12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab" Retrieves data for a set using its unique Scryfall ID. EXAMPLE 3 Get-MtgSet Retrieves data for all Magic: The Gathering sets. PARAMETERS -Code Specifies the unique three- or four-character code of the set to retrieve. For example, "LEA" for Limited Edition Alpha. Type: String Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: Required: False Position: 1 Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -Id Specifies the unique Scryfall ID of the set to retrieve. Type: String Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: Required: False Position: 2 Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -ProgressAction {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} Type: ActionPreference Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: proga Required: False Position: Named Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS If a specific set is requested (using -Code or -Id ), the function returns the set data as a PowerShell object. If no specific set is requested, the function returns an array of all available sets. NOTES This function uses the Scryfall API to fetch set data. Ensure you have an active internet connection to use this function. The `Invoke-RestMethod` cmdlet is used to send the API request. Only one of the parameters `-Code` or `-Id` can be used at a time. RELATED LINKS https://scryfall.com/docs/api
docs.title: Get-MtgSet

docs.text: Get-MtgSymbol SYNOPSIS Retrieves Magic: The Gathering symbols from the Scryfall API. SYNTAX Get-MtgSymbol [[-Symbol] <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION The `Get-MtgSymbol` function fetches all Magic: The Gathering symbols from the Scryfall API. It can return the full symbol data or filter for a specific symbol if the `-Symbol` parameter is provided. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Get-MtgSymbol Retrieves all Magic: The Gathering symbols from the Scryfall API. EXAMPLE 2 Get-MtgSymbol -Symbol "{W}" Retrieves data for the white mana symbol. PARAMETERS -Symbol Specifies a particular symbol to filter the results. If this parameter is provided, only the matching symbol's data will be returned. Type: String Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: Required: False Position: 1 Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -ProgressAction {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} Type: ActionPreference Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: proga Required: False Position: Named Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS If the -Symbol parameter is provided, the function returns the specific symbol's data. If no parameter is provided, the function returns all available symbols as an array of objects. NOTES This function uses the Scryfall API to fetch symbol data. Ensure you have an active internet connection to use this function. The `Invoke-RestMethod` cmdlet is used to send the API request. RELATED LINKS https://scryfall.com/docs/api
docs.title: Get-MtgSymbol

docs.text: Search-Mtg SYNOPSIS Searches for Magic: The Gathering cards using the Scryfall API. SYNTAX Search-Mtg [[-CardColor] <String>] [[-ManaValue] <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION The `Search-Mtg` function allows you to search for Magic: The Gathering cards based on card color and/or mana value. It constructs a query string and sends a request to the Scryfall API to retrieve card data. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Search-Mtg -CardColor "White" Searches for all white cards. EXAMPLE 2 Search-Mtg -ManaValue D1 Searches for all cards with a mana value of 3. EXAMPLE 3 Search-Mtg -CardColor "White" -ManaValue D2 Searches for all blue cards with a mana value of 1. PARAMETERS -CardColor Specifies the color of the card to search for. Type: String Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: Required: False Position: 1 Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -ManaValue Specifies the mana value (converted mana cost) of the card to search for. Type: String Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: Required: False Position: 2 Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False -ProgressAction {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} Type: ActionPreference Parameter Sets: (All) Aliases: proga Required: False Position: Named Default value: None Accept pipeline input: False Accept wildcard characters: False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS Returns the card data retrieved from the Scryfall API as a PowerShell object. NOTES This function uses the Scryfall API to perform the search. RELATED LINKS https://scryfall.com/docs/api
docs.title: Search-Mtg
